quotes.quote: True popularity is not the popularity which is followed after, but the popularity which follows after.
Being known by everyone is not the same as being loved.
Popularity - a piece of faded tinsel, that is out of date.
There is a price for popularity. Critics look for your weaknesses, your flaws, anything that makes the work seem like a fluke and not seem worthy of all the attention it's getting.
Love of popularity may create an artificial goodness, and stir up hypocrisy to adorn a whited sepulcher.
Popularity has become its own justification.
Popular feeling is very often sentimental, muddle-headed, and eminently unsound, but it cannot be disregarded for all that.
True popularity comes from acts of kindness rather than acts of stupidity.
Popularity is bound in issues of finding a public for oneself, an audience for which one might perform.
Anyone who is popular is bound to be disliked.
Popularity makes no sense If your fame is a shame.
Popularity comes from allowing yourself to be bored by people while pretending to enjoy it.
Popularity is not an accurate measurement of a man's worth in his community, nor of his estimation by Jehovah God.
Popularity is a form of collaborative filtering, which is a technology that uses the preferences of a community of users to recommend items to individual users.
Popularity is generally an appeal to the people from the sentence given by men of sense against them.
Feeling harder to be oneself might be a curse of popularity.
Popularity is not a guarantee of quality.
The consequences of seeking popularity is not only the chronic feeling of lonliness, but a desire to hide your face from the eyes of the universe.
People think being famous is so glamorous, but half the time you're in a strange hotel room living out of a suitcase.
Popularity is the easiest thing in the world to gain and it is the hardest thing to hold
Popular opinion is the greatest lie in the world.
That's the definition of popularity. Something that literally resonates with many, many people.
Whatever is popular deserves attention.
False has many wings. Do not judge anything by its popularity.
Popularity is glory's small change.
Popularity is like the brightness of a falling star, the fleeting splendor of a rainbow, the bubble that is sure to burst by its very inflation.
Avoid popularity if you would have peace.
Popularity is neither fame nor greatness.
When a hypocrite or a wicked leader is in power, anyone that becomes popular or stands out easily becomes a prey.
Do not yearn to be popular; be exquisite. Do not desire to be famous; be loved. Do not take pride in being expected; be palpable, unmistakable.
